lines.text:
[Gertie eats a tree and starts dancing]
Aw, stop that
[Gertie stops]
Be a good girl and bow to the audience
[Gertie obeys]
Thanks! Now raise your right foot
[Gertie obeys]
That's good! Now raise your left foot
[Gertie thinks, a huge sea serpent emerges from the lake, Gertie turns to look at the monster]
Never Mind that sea serpent! Gertie, raise your left foot.
[the snake hides, Gertie seems roar to the audience]
You're a bad girl, shame on you!
[Gertie begins to cry]
Oh, don't cry. Here, catch this pumpkin.

[Gertie swallows a large stump, later on, Gertie is thrilled to see a small mastodon]
Gertie, don't hurt Jumbo.

[a four-winged lizard is seen flying behind Gertie]
Did you see that four-winged lizard?
[Gertie nods]
Sure?
[Gertie nods again]
Are you in the habit of seeing things?
[Gertie says no]
Are you fibbing to me?
[Gertie says no again]
Will you have a little drink?
[Gertie nods]
There's a lake. Take a little drink if you want it.
[Gertie drinks the whole lake]
[last title card]
And George did.
[last lines]
Who pays for the dinner? Let George do it!
[first lines]
We've got a puncture. Let's go into the museum while he fixes it.
[first title card]

Winsor McCay, creator of "Little Nemo" and "Dreams of a Rarebit Fiend;" George McManus, creator of "The Newlyweds," "Bringing up Father" and "Let George do it;" Roy McCardell, humorist, and others, on a joy ride.

[to Geroge McManus]
I made ten thousand cartoons,-each one a little bit different from the one preceding it.
[Calls his assistant, he arrives]
Mr McManus wants to see some of the drawings.
